Broad question: can this simply replace the existing implementation, if it's better? I'd suggest it is important to not let a bunch of different implementations proliferate, but unify them.

In fact, if we set the `numInnerIteration = 1`, which is the default setting, then the `GradientDescentWithLocalUpdate` is identical to `GradientDescent`. However, I think it is better if we have opportunity to add new updater easily. End-user may have the requirement, for adding new customized updater.

Hi, @mateiz, thank you for reviewing this, 

just added the test cases for both old&new API-based saveAsHadoopDataset

I agree it could be an improvement.  I just don't want to cause confusion when their logs go to a different file when they turn debug on.  I'm not sure I have any other good ideas on ways around it.  Unless we just document (or put lines in the log4j.properties.template for yarn) that on yarn to get the same behavior use org.apache.hadoop.yarn.ContainerLogAppender.

@pwendell thoughts?
Sorry for use my master branch.

Would be lovely to see this patch in !
We have a whole bunch of hacks just to avoid memory and resource issues currently : this would alleviate a lot of them.

Left some comments on minor issues like formatting. LGTM otherwise.

@srowen According to [previous experiments](https://github.com/apache/incubator-spark/pull/407), this implementation is indeed better than the original one, +1 for the replacement.

@srowen Forgot to mention, [@etrain's comment](https://github.com/apache/incubator-spark/pull/407#issuecomment-33299956) should be one of the reasons why this PR doesn't try to replace the original one. BTW, basically I'm not an ML guy, so please ignore me if I'm saying rubbish :)

@mengxr tests are passing (the last message saying they're not is stale), should be ready

@yinxusen I'm still confused by the implementation. You want to make the entire content of a text file as the value returned by smallTextFiles. In the BatchFileRecordReader, the buffer size is limited by `MAX_BYTES_ALLOCATION`, and you merge the buffers from the same file in smallTextFiles to assemble the entire content. Is it necessary to take this approach? How does it differ from a simple `CombineWholeTextFileInputFormat`?

Hi @petko-nikolov,

Thanks a lot for contributing this patch! I left some comments to help the code conform to Spark coding style, and on test coverage. It would be great if you can update the PR. 

Again, thanks for the patch!

Would it be possible to just put tachone inside of the top level directory rather than `/sbin`. It seems a bit confusing for people to go into sbin to find the Tachyon logs, conf, etc.
@ScrapCodes This is updated to pick up the changes from 1246.

The issue with putting tachyon somewhere else is that tachyon defaults to the layout we have now.  There are a bunch of environment vars I could set to move things around, but that would require more sed magic and more files in this PR.  If you think that's worth it, I could make that happen.

Alternately, tachyon could live entirely in its own tachyon/ subdir, and the spark scripts could call "$sbin"/../tachyon/bin/tachyon.
Good catch. Please commit (I cant access right now :-) )

Hey @nicklan Yep - I was suggesting the second thing. Don't mess with Tachyon's internal layout, just move all of tachyon to a top level dir and then have the bin scripts go up a directory and call it.
Seems like somehow this isn't in scope where it's accessed? Jenkins, test this please.
Sorry when I was cleaning up he patch to remove log messages I accidentally removed the import.
